text.0: as sits the young bird on the tree rejoicing ye swift pair have been roused by clear laudation.
text.1: whose heraldpriest through many days is indra earths guardian friend of men the best of heroes.
text.2: may we when this dawn and the next dance hither be thy best servants most heroic hero.
text.3: let the victorious car with triple splendour bring hitherward the hundred chiefs with kutsa.
text.4: what was the gladdening draught that pleased thee indra speed through our doors to songs for thou art mighty.
text.5: why comest thou to me what gift attracts thee fain would i bring thee food most meet to offer.
text.6: indra what fame hath one like thee mid heroes with what plan wilt thou act why hast thou sought us.
text.7: as a true friend widestrider to sustain us since food absorbs the thought of each among us.
text.8: speed happily those as sūrya ends his journey who meet his wish as bridegrooms meet their spouses.
text.9: men who present o indra strong by nature with food the many songs that tell thy praises.
text.10: thine are two measures indra widewellmeted heaven for thy majesty earth for thy wisdom.
text.11: here for thy choice are somas mixed with butter may the sweet meath be pleasant for thy drinking.
text.12: they have poured out a bowl to him to indra full of sweet juice for faithful is his bounty.
text.13: oer earths expanse hath he grown great by wisdom the friend of man and by heroic exploits.
text.14: indra hath conquered in his wars the mighty men strive in multitudes to win his friendship.
text.15: ascend thy chariot as it were in battle which thou shalt drive to us with gracious favour.
